intro: Mentzelia linearifolia, commonly known as the linearleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and pale blue to lavender flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and desert scrublands. It produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Mentzelia linearifolia is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
